text: [Music]
so we grow food in cities uh we're
actually Urban Farmers um so about 8
years ago we had this vision of growing
food where people live and growing it
more sustainably and our concept is
simple uh we use no new land so we take
existing buildings usually Warehouse
spaces uh big low flat buildings and we
build rooftops that we can operate year
round uh growing fresh food for the
local the local community the local
folks uh just around us and we grow food
with about half the energy uh because we
get a lot of energy from the building
below we're also insulating the building
uh we grow using no pesticides
herbicides or fungicides so it's very
sustainable we actually introduce
insects in the farm to fight off other
insects um and we try to create an
equilibrium uh really copying what
Mother Nature does we also grow
polyculture so in one of our Farms if
you walk in it looks like a living
grocery store you've got tomatoes
cucumbers pepper lettuce herbs I it
essentially there are times where we're
growing over 50 things in the same
Greenhouse so polyculture has been very
helpful it's actually made growing food
easier from a managing pest's
perspective so early on we decided to be
to take a page out of the
CSA uh basket program that is quite
established in North America and we said
we would go straight to Consumers
initially it was a fixed basket we had
about 200 subscribers that got this
weekly basket and they had no choice
fast forward 3 and a half years we have
about 5,000 subscribers uh two green
houses is we offer our foods and our
partner Farms food and you can choose
what you want online so it's a on one
hand an amazing online service on
another hand it's and a very very farmy
uh connection to the land type uh
Service uh and that's roughly what we do
that's at the Montreal level and for us
the next big thing is expanding luah
abroad I mean for since the start of the
company we've been struggling with what
would be the best model the best formula
to copy what we have done here in
Montreal Elsewhere for us our vision is
to uh change the way people eat in
cities
[Music]
